main event: A pilot spotted multiple bright, reddish-orange objects maneuvering in a definite formation over Mount Rainier, Washington on July 21, 1952.
interesting points: The objects were estimated to be around 2500 feet above the ground.
The objects were moving at an estimated speed of 600 mph.
The pilot tried to close in on the objects, but they suddenly accelerated and disappeared from sight.
This incident was never brought to the attention of Project Blue Book as it was reported through normal intelligence channels and considered a high priority at the time.

The Air Force position is that there is no authenticated evidence to prove the existence of interplanetary spaceships, and they will investigate reports from reliable sources but cannot assume responsibility for investigating reports from individual citizens.
sighted object: Multiple bright, reddish-orange objects maneuvering in a definite formation
